title: Abide with Me

author.name: Henry Francis Lyte
author.bio: Henry Francis Lyte was a Scottish Anglican minister and hymn writer, best known for his hymns 'Abide with Me' and 'Praise, My Soul, the King of Heaven.' His hymns are characterized by their depth of faith and comforting themes.

lyrics:
Abide with me;
Fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens;
Lord, with me abide!
When other helpers fail,
And comforts flee,
Help of the helpless,
O abide with me.

Swift to its close ebbs
Out life's little day;
Earth's joys grow dim,
Its glories pass away;
Change and decay
In all around I see;
O Thou who changest not,
Abide with me!

I need Thy presence
Every passing hour;
What but Thy grace
Can foil the tempter's power?
Who like Thyself my guide
And stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine Lord,
Abide with me.

I fear no foe,
With Thee at hand to bless;
l’ll have no weight,
And tears no bitterness;
Where is death's sting?
Where, grave, Thy victory?
l’ll triumph still,
lf Thou abide with me.

Hold Thou Thy cross
Before my closing eyes,
Shine through the gloom,
And point me to the skies;
Heaven's morning breaks,
And Earth's vain shadows flee;
In life, in death,
O Lord, abide with me!
